intro: Dehaasia undulata, commonly known as the wavy-leaved daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its undulating, wavy-edged leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Dehaasia undulata is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and modest blooms.
